text: He who is selfish seeks a craving;\f + \fr 18:1 \ft Or “boundary” \f*
against all sound judgment he shows contempt.
A fool will not take pleasure in understanding,
but in expressing his heart.\f + \fr 18:2 \ft Or “mind” \f*
With the coming of wickedness comes contempt also,
and with dishonor, disgrace.
Deep waters \add are\add* words of the mouth of a man;
a gushing stream \add is\add* a fountain of wisdom.
Being partial \add to\add* faces of evil \add is\add* not good,
\add nor\add* to subvert the righteous at the judgment.
The lips of a fool will bring strife,
and his mouth calls out for a flogging.
The mouth of a fool \add is\add* ruin to him,
and his lips \add are\add* a snare to his soul.\f + \fr 18:7 \ft Or “life,” or “inner self” \f*
The words of a whisper \add are\add* like delicious morsels,
and they themselves go down \add to\add* inner parts of the body.
Even he who is slack in his work,
he is brother to a master\f + \fr 18:9 \ft Or “owner” \f* of destruction.
A tower of strength is the name of Yahweh;
into him\f + \fr 18:10 \ft Or “it” \f* the righteous will run and be safe.
The wealth of the rich \add is\add* ⸤his strong city⸥,\f + \fr 18:11 \ft Literally “a city of his strength” \f*
and like a wall, it is high in his imagination.
In the presence of destruction, the heart\f + \fr 18:12 \ft Or “mind” \f* of a man will be haughty,
but in the presence of honor, humble.
He who returns a word before he will hear,
folly itself \add belongs\add* to him as well as\f + \fr 18:13 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* shame.
The spirit of a man will endure his sickness,
but a broken spirit, who may bear it?
An intelligent ⸤mind⸥\f + \fr 18:15 \ft Literally “heart” \f* will acquire knowledge,
and the ear of the wise will seek knowledge.
The gift of a person will open doors for him,
and before the great, it gives him access.
The first in his dispute is \add deemed\add* righteous,
\add but\add* his neighbor will come and examine him.
The lot will put an end to disputes,
and between powerful contenders it will decide.
A brother who is offended \add is worse\add* than a city of strength,
and quarrels \add are\add* like the bars of a fortification.
From the fruit of a man’s mouth, his stomach will be satisfied,
as for the yield of his lips, it will satisfy.
Death and life \add are\add* in the ⸤power⸥\f + \fr 18:21 \ft Literally “hand” \f* of the tongue,
and those who love her\f + \fr 18:21 \ft That is, the power of the tongue \f* will eat of her fruit.
He who finds a wife\f + \fr 18:22 \ft Or “woman” \f* finds good,
and he will obtain favor from Yahweh.
The poor may speak entreaties,
but the rich will answer roughly.
A man of \add many\add* friends will come to ruin,
but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
